title: Coelophysis
summary: Coelophysis (/sɛˈlɒfɪsɪs/ seh-LOF-ih-sis traditionally; /ˌsɛloʊˈfaɪsɪs/ SEL-o-FY-sis or /ˌsiːloʊˈfaɪsɪs/ SEE-lo-FY-sis, as heard more commonly in recent decades[5]) is an extinct genus of coelophysid theropod dinosaur that lived approximately 221.5[6] to 196 million years ago during the latter part of the Triassic Period in what is now the southwestern United States[7] and also in South Africa and Zimbabwe.[8]
